info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 6:41PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CLEARFIELD... CENTRAL CENTRE AND WEST CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTIES THROUGH 715 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles northwest of Bellefonte, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Snow Shoe, Clarence, Moshannon, Pine Glen, Monument, Bald Eagle State Park, Howard, Grassflat and Orviston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
